definition: to examine/to investigate/to try to determine
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: For an example, examine Acts 2, the Pentecost account.
sentences.chinese: 比如，查考使徒行传2章五旬节的故事。

sentences.english: Again, it will be impossible to include everything from the exegetical study.
sentences.chinese: 再次重申，讲道不可能包括解经查考的所有内容。

sentences.english: It is that last phrase that we need to examine carefully.
sentences.chinese: 最后一句值得我们去细细查考。

sentences.english: Examine the Law and let it strike your heart to lead you to repentance.
sentences.chinese: 查考其中的律法并让它鞭策你的内心，引导你悔改。

sentences.english: Look into it, and you will find that a prophet does not come out of Galilee.
sentences.chinese: 你且去查考，就可知道加利利没有出过先知。

sentences.english: Archaeologists were trying to ascertain the date of a new LOT of unearthed relics.
sentences.chinese: 考古学家正在查考一批新出土文物的年代。

definition: to do textual research/to make textual criticism/to verify by means of research (esp. historical details)/to take an exam to get a certificate (abbr. for 考取證件|考取证件[kao3 qu3 zheng4 jian4])
to study/to examine/to probe/to study the underlying principles
general history of a county/county annals
to cite/to quote/to cite as evidence
to decide/to determine/established practice/(dialect) firmly resolved (to do sth)
